method.name: Steady-State Genetic Algorithm for Instance Selection

reference.ref: J.R. Cano, F. Herrera, M. Lozano. Using evolutionary algorithms as instance selection for data reduction in KDD: An experimental study. IEEE Transaction on Evolutionary Computation 7:6 (2003) 561-575

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Evolutionary
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: Application of a Steady-State Genetic Algorithm to the Instance Selection Problem.

parameterSpec.param: 1 to 0 Mutation Probability: Real value. Probability associated to a change from 1 to 0 in the mutation operator.
0 to 1 Mutation Probability: Real value. Probability associated to a change from 0 to 1 in the mutation operator.
Cross Probability: Real value. Probability associated to perform a crossover operator
Population Size: Integer value. Number of chromosome belonging to the population (if it is odd, elitism is applied).
Number of Evaluations: Integer value. Maximal number of evaluations allowed in the run of the algorithm
Alfa Equilibrate Factor: Real value. Trade-off factor that controls the balaning between reduction and accuracy
Selection Mechanism: Scheme of selection of parents. Based on Baker or Binary Tournament.
Number of neighbors: Integer value. Number of nearest instances considered to classify an example using the K-Nearest Neighbor Rule

Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
